intro: Knautia diodon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Knautia diodon is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
